body:

Let's start with her stats and the game length.

Just under 30 minutes elapsed during the game.
0-13-0 and 46 CS with 7.2k gold earned.

If Annie was participating at all in team fights, she likely would get a spell off before dying, scoring at least one assist or kill at some point. However, given her death count of 13, she was dying far too often to be in team fights at all. With at least 1 minute to spawn then get back into lane, team fights could not be happening every 2 minutes for her to be dying that much.

If Annie was constantly split pushing, she would have much higher CS. However, she could not possibly have racked up 13 deaths if she was split pushing that much since enemies would not be catching her that often in favor of wiping her team first 5v4.

Based on just the stats within that screen shot, I have no reason to believe she was doing anything but intentional feeding.

If this was indeed a Riot employee, they should be punished and fired for being poor representatives of the company and establishing a negative reputation.
If this was not a Riot employee, the player should be banned for impersonating one since it is deemed wrong in the Terms of Use.

What do I need more proof of?

The intentional feeding? Seems pretty obvious at this point based on how often Annie was dying.
The Rioter status? It doesn't matter on this one. All it does is change the reason for punishment.

Let's add that perhaps this player didn't say anything all game. Chat logs will, most likely, only provide additional evidence for the Annie being toxic. There is an incredibly small chance that Annie wasn't toxic in chat while still talking. And if Annie never used it, what then? We are still only left with her numbers. The short answer remains that it's near impossible to consistently die without a kill or assist unless you're intentionally doing it.

So, here's what it has boiled down to.

1. The player was a Rioter who has intentionally fed. As a Rioter who should be setting an example, they should be punished even if this was not consistent behavior.
2. The player was not a Rioter who intentionally fed. Regardless of whether this is consistent behavior, the player needs to be punished for impersonating a Rioter.

Both of those are pretty much the only possible outcomes. The odds of Annie simply performing poorly are too small to be considered a reasonable outcome.

I've looked up the account, I found the game. Its the only one in the last 20 this action was taken. It's also clear from the game stats from other games that this player, in the game op posts, was not even attempting to try to play and win. It's also pretty obvious this is not an annie player. While the account has mostly poor performances (suggesting this player is indeed just bad) that one annie game looks completely different from the rest of the games. Its clear looking at the game history that the annie game was intentionally trolled, it was not a computer issue, there is a ranked game as malphite immediately following it where the player played well and basically what I would expect of a silver level player.

Looking at all the evidence I can see, it still looks to me like the annie in the screenshot intentionally trolled in this specific game, in ranked, and should be punished for it immediately.

I do not tolerate that kind of behavior from ANY player, regardless of Riot employee or not. The fact it is a Riot employee who intentionally trolled this game only makes it worse.

I understand my view on this is not a view shared by everyone, I am extremely intolerant of that type of toxic in game action as I believe it is the worst thing a player can do in a competitive game and I would vote to ban players after a single instance of intentionally trolling and feeding while also refusing to cooperate with the team. That is how I would handle it, that is how I handled it in the past with Tribunal, and I will stand by that viewpoint until the end of time. That type of action has no business in a ranked match, ever, and it should be met with immediate and swift punishment. As far as I am concerned, looking at the game history for the account, the employee should not be fired, it was a single game in the 40 I've looked at now, but they should be put on notice to NEVER again take this type of action when they are supposed to be an ambassador of the game.
